abstract: Ashley Diamond, transgender woman who was imprisoned for over three years in male prisons in Georgia, has struggled to adjust to life outside jail; Diamond was often confined to solitary to keep her safe, and she claims to have been repeatedly sexually assaulted; Diamond is required by her parole plan to live in her conservative hometown in Georgia, which has made transition from prison life doubly challenging.
lead_paragraph: For a transgender woman whose imprisonment was traumatic and who is returning to her conservative hometown, re-entering society is an extra challenge.

headline.main: Ashley Diamond, Transgender Inmate, Is Out of Prison but Far From Free
headline.print_headline: Out of Prison, but Far From Free

snippet: For a transgender woman whose imprisonment was traumatic and who is returning to her conservative hometown, re-entering society is an extra challenge.
